note.p: Death: Lake, near Salisbury, Wiltshire (22 August 1940)
Career: Professor of Physics, University College, Liverpool (1881-1900); Principal, University of Birmingham (1900-1911)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1939-1941 vol 3 pp 551-574, plate, by R A Gregory and Allan Ferguson
References: Sir Bernard Lovell, 'The Invention of Radio Communication', review of Peter Rowlands and J Patrick Wilson, eds, Oliver Lodge and the Invention of Radio in NR 1997 vol 51 pp 151-153
A D Boney, 'The Summer of 1914: Diary of a Botanist' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 323-338
Brebis Bleaney, 'A Century of Physics in Oxford' in NR 1999 vol 53 pp 333-343
Leslie Green, review of Peter Rowlands, Oliver Lodge and the Liverpool Physical Society in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 279-281
